Developing Gene Therapies
to transform the life of patients
and their families.

Noga Therapeutics was established in 2019 in memory
of Noga Baumatz with a mission to develop gene therapies
for Primary Immune Deficiencies (PID).

What are PID's

Primary Immune Deficiency diseases are rare, genetic disorders that impair the immune system. Without a functional immune response, people with PIDs may be subject to chronic, debilitating infections.

In the past decade, gene therapies have shown encouraging results in several PIDs. However, most remain without effective treatment options.

Why Gene Therapy?

Current standard of care for most PID's is Hematopoeitic Stem Cell Transplant (HSCT) which has many drawbacks that are overcome by Gene Therapy.

HSCT

Harsh conditioning (radiation, chemotherapy)
Requires a matched donor
Poor life quality due to Graft Vs Host Disease (GVHD), and other disease specific complications
Many patients remain dependent on Immunoglobulin replacement therapy even after transplant
Often a 2nd HSCT is required due to poor immune system reconstitution
Overall survival rate of 60-75%

Gene Therapy

Reduced or no conditioning treatment
Using own patient’s cells
Normal life quality
Full restoration of the immune system removes the need for Immunoglobulin replacement therapy
One-time curative treatment
No failures recorded at the last decade

The Therapy

In Lentiviral Autologous Gene Therapy, stem cells are collected from the patient, mutations are corrected using lentiviruses and then the repaired cells are re-introduced into the patient.

  • 200+ patients with PID's have been successfully treated;
  • 12 years in the clinic with no reports of major adverse events;
  • Currently dozens of ongoing clinical trials;
  • New therapies soon to enter the market.

Lead Indication

Noga Tx is currently developing a lentiviral vector for our lead indication.

This project is done in collaboration with Schneider - Children's Medical Center with 30 patients under care. We aim to conduct a first-in-human trial in dozens of XLA patients at Schneider.

Our pipeline includes two additional PIDs in the evaluation phase.

Market

Our lead indication is a disease with a high burden and poor treatment options presenting a true unmet need. With over 3000 patients in the Western world alone, the projected market size is 2 Billion USD.

Investors

Ongoing research and development collaboration with Lonza, a global leader in biologics manufacturing and Cell & Gene Therapy, including:

  • Cash investment;
  • Development in Lonza's CocoonTM automated cell therapy system;
  • Commitment to manufacturing lentiviral vectors.

Business Opportunity

Success of lentiviral gene therapy companies in previous years was based on results with small numbers of patients.

Positive results in early trials were value drivers as can be seen by the increase of the market value of the following companies:

We are currently seeking to partner with additional investors that will take us to a first-in-human trial in Israel.
